TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DateRangeEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the or events of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event occurs when the currently selected date or range of dates changes; for example, when the user explicitly changes a selection within the current month or when the selection is implicitly changed in response to next/previous month navigation. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateSelected> event occurs when the user explicitly changes a selection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor specifies the start and end for the new date range that has been selected.
> [!NOTE] > If a single date is selected, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs.End%2A> property values will be equal.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
## Examples The following example displays a form containing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control that displays one calendar year. The example demonstrates setting properties like <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleBackColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleForeColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.CalendarDimensions%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TrailingForeColor%2A> to customize the look of the calendar control. Other properties like <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.AnnuallyBoldedDates%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BoldedDates%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MonthlyBoldedDates%2A> are set to customize which dates are bolded. The example also sets properties to change the calendar format, including <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.FirstDayOfWeek%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateSelected> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> events are also handled and their status displayed on the form.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/CPP/monthcalendar.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/CS/monthcalendar.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/VB/monthcalendar.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.DateTime start, valuetype System.DateTime end) cil managed

Docs.param: The first date/time value in the range that the user has selected.
The last date/time value in the range that the user has selected.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs.End%2A> property values are set by the `start` and `end` parameter values of this constructor.

Docs.summary: Gets the last date/time value in the range that the user has selected.
Docs.value: A that represents the last date in the date range that the user has selected.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example displays a form containing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control that displays one calendar year. The example demonstrates setting properties like <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleBackColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleForeColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.CalendarDimensions%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TrailingForeColor%2A> to customize the look of the calendar control. Other properties like <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.AnnuallyBoldedDates%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BoldedDates%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MonthlyBoldedDates%2A> are set to customize which dates are bolded. The example also sets properties to change the calendar format, including <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.FirstDayOfWeek%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateSelected> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> events are also handled and their status displayed on the form.

Docs.summary: Gets the first date/time value in the range that the user has selected.
Docs.value: A that represents the first date in the date range that the user has selected.

remarks.format:
